question.text: The given illustration shows the skull of two different mammals. Which of the following accurately describes the differences between these skulls?

options.text: Skull <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has less brain capacity than skull <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>
Skull  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>  is of primate and skull  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>  is not of primate
Skull  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>  is the skull of human and skull  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>  is the skull of an ape
Skull  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>  and skull  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>  are of baby chimpanzee and adult chimpanzee respectively

solution.text:
The main differences between human and ape skull in the above diagram are as follows":

1 Ape skull is more protruding

2 Apes have large brow ridges

3 In apes the forehead is receding

4 Zygomatic arch is much larger in apes.

All the above features are seen in B and thus it represents Skull of Apes.
